Yesterday at FSC, I asked CEOs about something known as countercyclical capital buffers.

Think of it as a “rainy day” rule, so banks must stock up 💰 to prepare for a downturn, so they aren’t caught empty-handed as they were in 2008. https://twitter.com/vtg2/status/1116093413177352193 QT @vtg2 .@AOC told me after the hearing: “It’s an almost universally acknowledged economic practice that at times where the economy is surging, at least according to overall GDP, that we should be shoring up our capital buffers.” Otherwise, in a downturn “we won’t be as prepared.” #CCyB https://twitter.com/vtg2/status/1116058678602416129
